title: Joyce structures and their twistor spaces
abstract:
Joyce structures are a class of geometric structures which first arose in
relation to holomorphic generating functions for Donaldson-Thomas invariants.
They can be thought of as non-linear analogues of Frobenius structures, or as
special classes of complex hyperkahler manifolds. We give a detailed
introduction to Joyce structures, with particular focus on the geometry of the
associated twistor space. We also prove several new results.
